reviews.text: We stayed in the bungalows, as opposed to the treehouses.. there didn't seem to be a lot of photos on the web of the treehouses, and I'm glad we picked the private bungalows instead. Very basic rooms with air con, showers took a little while to warm up, but did the job. The main front area has awesome decks with cushions to chill out on and the wi-fi there means you can spend hours catching up on emails. Food is good too.
reviews.title: Basic rooms... does the job...

reviews.text: Unfortunately I was on a tight schedule so I only stayed one night, but Olympos is one of those places you could lounge for days. Lots of friendly travelers in a very chill atmosphere, including outdoor couches. Dinner and breakfast is included in the price, in buffet style where you can come back for seconds.
reviews.title: Great choice for Olympos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and I stayed here for two nights in May and loved it! We had a bungalow with a private (and beautifully hot) shower, which was simple but sufficient. We were really impressed with the staff, the breakfast and dinner that is included in the price (some of the best food we had in Turkey) and it is a pleasant walk from here to the beach (beware: its VERY pebbly!).
reviews.title: Great place to chill!

reviews.text: We also booked the 4d3n Blue Cruise tour through these guys and were impressed.
reviews.title: Relaxing & fun

reviews.text: The only thing I was disappointed in was the Chimera Tour. It was 20TL per person and, although its is called a 'tour', really you are just paying for the dolmus ride. If I went back I would got to the Chimera site in the evening on my own and then work out a dolmus ride back to Olympus with one of the groups that would be there.
reviews.title: Great value, good place to meet other travelers
Disappointing
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bayram tree houses for one night and were pleased to leave. I felt like I was on a school camp! The "tree houses" we no more than a timber box located just above ground level with similar boxes no more a than a meter apart. The hotel staff were very pleasant ( from Brisbane ) and the meals though basic were quite good..... Lining up to be served boarding school style was my idea of an enjoyable evening. As for the rooms the linen was well warn and showed it age! The air conditioning was noisy, and as for the shower and toilet - basic! The location of the tree houses was also very disappointing, the beach is about 500m down a dirt road and you have to pay to go to the beach, the water is dirty and the beach crowded.

Great place to stay. Not actually a treehouse but kind of like a wooden cabin kind of room. Air con which was really effective. Clean room. Clean bathrooms and showers but could do with some more toilets as sometimes the toilets were a bit busy. Lovely food. Had breakfast and dinner included in price. Really good value, super variety of food and friendly and obliging staff. A short walk to the beach and also a nice chilled vibe in the evenings.
reviews.title: Bayrams Tree houses, Olympus

reviews.text: Pro:
reviews.title: I liked it even if they have to improve clean and wi-fi strength

reviews.text: -lounge atmosphere,very tranquil, relaxing, with open spaces between trees full of pillows and tables
reviews.title: Thanks for our wonderful memories!

reviews.text: -position: it's one of the closest solutions to the beach
reviews.title: Chill Out & walk under a small forest

reviews.text: This hostel was very nicely run and organized. We experienced great hospitality by the front desk and restaurant staff while we were there and appreciated it greatly!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, consistant

reviews.text: We chose to stay in a private bungalow that had it's own bathroom and AC. These are stand a lone rooms that look like little houses, that are 2 feet off the ground and laid out in a grid. The bungalows are very close to each other, but once we were inside with the air conditioning on, we could not hear anything... not even the chickens and baby chicks that ran around under the buildings in the mornings!
reviews.title: Super social chill out zone

reviews.text: We thought everything was very clean, from the grounds (no trash and not dusty at the communal areas and the fire pits), to the interior of the room and bathroom. The mattresses weren't luxurious but we slept fine and the sheets and blankets were freshly washed. There was a bit of a wait for the hot water heater in the morning but any backpacker will see that it is normal for the area & type of heaters. Once the hot water got going, it was plentiful and pressure was great.
reviews.title: Chill out, big time!

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was fine, nothing special but there was plenty to go around. Lots of restaurants and other hostels in the area to eat at or walk around. It was great how close they are located to the beach and the ruins on the coast, those were beautiful.
reviews.title: Terrible place to stay

reviews.text: Bayrams hostel is great- not quite the tree house fantasy most people have but has basic and clean cabins and a fantastic huge and very social area so it is ideal for solo travelers. Its a 10 minute walk to the beach, which can be overwhelming on a hot day but you can always just wait for late afternoon while chilling in the hang-out area. Fun dance club in walking distance. Food is ok and the vibe is great. Closest place to the beach in Olympus- if you want to actually be ON the beach, go to Cirali rather.
reviews.title: Stay here!!

reviews.text: I've stayed in some eco lodge/tree house-style places that have been filthy. This is not the case at Bayram's -- this is a stellar hotel!
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, laid back, great food

reviews.text: Wood-panelled rooms are simple, but very clean with comfortable beds. Also, all rooms, including the dormitories, have modern a/c units.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!

reviews.text: Breakfast and dinner are included -- all-you-can-eat portions with healthy, fresh food. Breakfast includes cooked-to-order eggs and dinner is delicious.
reviews.title: A wonderful time at summer camp!

reviews.text: Staff are friendly and accommodating -- it's nice that they don't demand money immediately for every service (i.e. reserving a bus and then paying for it after dinner is fine).
reviews.title: Ah-mazing
Backpacker/Traveler Treat
reviews.text: Lastly, excellent location -- one of the closest tree house complexes to the national park/beach (i.e. easy 10 minute walk whereas others further down the road are a bit of a hike).
